words.definition: A chamber is an old word for a bedroom.
words.example: The king stayed in his chamber to rest.

words.definition: To deny something is to say it is not true.
words.example: The boy denied that he broke the window.

words.definition: A document is an official piece of writing.
words.example: He signed the document to finish the deal.

words.definition: To emphasize is to give importance or attention to something.
words.example: The teacher emphasized the importance of hard work.

words.definition: A fever is a high body temperature.
words.example: He had a fever, so he stayed in bed all day.

words.definition: The flu is a common illness that makes you feel tired and weak.
words.example: Many people get the flu in the winter.

words.definition: To freeze is to become very cold or turn into ice.
words.example: If the water gets cold enough, it will freeze.

words.definition: A gesture is a movement of the hands or body to express an idea.
words.example: He made a hand gesture to say hello.

words.definition: To interrupt is to stop someone when they are talking or doing something.
words.example: Please do not interrupt me while I am working.

words.definition: To last is to continue for a period of time.
words.example: The movie lasted for two hours.

words.definition: Likeness is the state of being similar or looking like someone else.
words.example: There is a strong likeness between the two brothers.

words.definition: Moreover is used to add more information to what has been said.
words.example: It’s a nice car. Moreover, it’s not very expensive.

words.definition: A perspective is a way of thinking about or looking at something.
words.example: The trip gave me a new perspective on life.

words.definition: When something is rational, it is based on reason or logic.
words.example: It is not rational to be afraid of the dark.

words.definition: To recover is to get well after being ill or injured.
words.example: It took her a long time to recover from her cold.

words.definition: To rely on something or someone is to trust or depend on them.
words.example: I rely on my alarm clock to wake me up.

words.definition: Shock is a feeling of being very surprised or upset.
words.example: The news of the accident was a big shock to us.

words.definition: When people are shy, they are nervous about meeting or talking to people.
words.example: The shy girl did not want to speak to the class.

words.definition: To stare is to look at something for a long time with eyes wide open.
words.example: I stared at the painting for a long time.

words.definition: Thus is used to mean “as a result” or “in this way.”
words.example: He studied hard. Thus, he got a good grade.
